content:
I apologize for any confusion, I understand now that you are looking for 5 bottles of Sauvignon Blanc from the Loire Valley in France that are priced under 150,000 won and also to mention their vintage and the full name of the wine.

Here are five bottles of Sauvignon Blanc from the Loire Valley in France that are priced under 150,000 won, and would pair well with your Grüner Veltliner Schloss Gobelsberg Ram and the blue egg dish:

1. Sancerre "Les Belles Vignes" Domaine Paul Prieur - This wine is known for its bright acidity and flavors of citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. It would complement the Grüner Veltliner nicely and would also work well with the dish of blue eggs, sabayon, pickled mussel, seaweed bugak, and salt bush oil. A good vintage for this would be 2019
2. Pouilly-Fumé "Les Chailloux" Domaine de la Taille aux Loups - This wine is known for its bright acidity and flavors of citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. It would complement the Grüner Veltliner nicely and would also work well with the dish of blue eggs, sabayon, pickled mussel, seaweed bugak, and salt bush oil. A good vintage for this would be 2018
3. Quincy "Les Rameaux" Domaine de la Pépière - This wine is known for its bright acidity and flavors of citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. It would complement the Grüner Veltliner nicely and would also work well with the dish of blue eggs, sabayon, pickled mussel, seaweed bugak, and salt bush oil. A good vintage for this would be 2019
4. Menetou-Salon "Les Brosses" Domaine Paul Cherrier - This wine is known for its bright acidity and flavors of citrus, green apple, and mineral notes. It would complement the Grüner Veltliner nicely and would also work well with the dish of blue eggs, sabayon, pickled mussel, seaweed bugak, and salt bush oil. A
